conversation.content: Oh wow, um, my roommate just told me she's moving out next month! This is actually such a crazy opportunity!
Oh god, that's the worst feeling in the world. I remember when my roommate did that to me, left me completely stranded with double rent and this crushing sense of betrayal.
No no, so this could be amazing! You know, I've been wanting to redecorate forever!
Well, I mean, sure, redecorating sounds fun until you're basically scrambling to find someone who won't destroy your newly decorated space within a week.
True, but like, think about all the possibilities! I could honestly find someone who shares my interests, er, maybe even becomes a best friend!
Oh uhh, finding a decent roommate is sort of [sarcastic] super easy these days, anyway, everyone's totally normal with no bizarre habits or red flags whatsoever.
You're being negative! This could be the best thing that ever happened to me!
Look, I've been through seven roommates in five years, and each one started with optimism and ended with me changing the locks and deep cleaning mysterious stains.
But imagine all the new people I'll meet during interviews! It'll be like speed dating but for friendship!
The thing is, hmm, those interviews are tortureâ€”people lie about everything, actually, from their cleanliness habits to whether they have secret pet ferrets they're hiding.
Oh, I could really [excited] turn this into a whole adventure! Kind of like a reality show casting call!
A reality show? I guess that's one way to frame it, uh, though honestly most reality shows end in tears and lawsuits if we're being realistic here.
Maybe I'll make a fun questionnaire! With personality tests and everything!
Questionnaires are great until someone seems perfect on paper, well, then you know [pause] they move in and suddenly they're practicing bagpipes at 3am, basically every night.
Come on, so what are the odds of that? I mean, this city is full of amazing people, actually!
The odds are higher than you think. This city is full of people pretending to be normal while harboring deeply concerning habits that only emerge after signing a lease.
You know what, um, I'm going to embrace this! Like, every experience teaches us something, anyway!
Absolutely.
See! Even you agree! I'm honestly going to, err, start posting ads tonight and well, see what happens!
I wasn't agreeing, I was surrendering to your relentless optimism, but sure, go ahead and learn these lessons the hard way like the rest of us did.
